description: Construction of 3 storey building with basement level to include 8 self-contained flats, provision of a rear communal garden and  associated forecourt  landscaping, parking, refuse storage facilities and cycle storage (following demolition of existing building)
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s): PA01Rev F (lower ground and ground floor); PA02 Rev D (1st, 2nd, floor and roof plan); PA03 Rev E (section drawing); PA04 Rev E (proposed elevations); P05 Rev D (neighbours elevation context); PA 06 (landscaping at 2nd floor); PA10 Rev F (proposed floor plans); Proposed Master Plan Rev A dated June 2020 (landscaping); Proposed Back Garden Rev A dated June 2020; Flood risk Assessment; Drainage assessment; SRE outline sustainability and Energy Statement; Existing Underground drainage; Tree Report - Tree Protection; BRE Daylight and Sunlight Study
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| Details of all external materials shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the  Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of works on site. Materials should closely match those detailed in approved plan PA01 Rev F.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016); Draft New London Plan(2019) policy D4 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | Prior to occupation of the site further details for the artificial external lighting of the building fronting Park Hill, its front lightwells, side pathways and external communal areas within the curtilage of the site, including the cycle storage area, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Proposed lighting shall not exceed lux levels of vertical illumination at neighbouring premises that are recommended by the Institution of Lighting Professionals in the 'Guidance Notes For The Reduction Of Light Pollution 2011'. Lighting should be minimised and glare and sky glow should be prevented by correctly using, locating, aiming and shielding luminaires, in accordance with the Guidance Notes.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties and future occupiers of the site in accordance with policy 7.4 of the London Plan 2016 and 7A and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013); policies 7.1 of the London Plan (2016); policies D4, D11 and HC1 Draft New London Plan(2019)-intend to publish; and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | Prior to occupation of the flats, the proposed hard and biodiverse soft landscaping, green roofing and boundary treatments to the front and rear gardens including lightwells, sunken rear gardens and roof top terraces as shown in the approved plans Proposed Master Plan Rev A dated June 2020 (landscaping); Proposed Back Garden Rev A dated June 2020 and PA06 shall be implemented in full.

Any planting that is part of the approved scheme that within a period of five years after planting is removed, dies or becomes seriously damaged or diseased, shall be replaced in the next planting season. All planting shall be replaced with others of a similar size and species and in the same position, and shall be retained thereafter.

Reason:  To ensure a satisfactory standard of appearance and setting for the development and to ensure that the proposed development enhances biodiversity and the visual amenity of the locality,  in accordance with policies 5.10, 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy 7.4 and of the London Plan (2016) policy G5 of the Draft New London Plan(2019)-intend to publish; the London Environment strategy (2018) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | The sound insulation of the building envelope including glazing specifications and external amenity areas shall be in accordance with the Council's assessment standards of the SPG10 and achieve compliance with the acoustic criteria specified in BS8233:2014. The above shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and shall be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy 7.15 of The London Plan (2016), Ealing's SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).  | Privacy screening to a height of 1.8m on the flanks of the rear balconies shall be present and retained thereafter

Reason: To ensure the proposed development does not affect the amenity of neighbours and the privacy of future occupants in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 and of the London Plan (2016) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | Notwithstanding the reports submitted with this planning application, prior to the commencement of development, an updated Demolition and Construction Management Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of works on site. The plan shall include the following:
o Details of construction hours; Demolition and Construction methods including further details for a basement impact assessment;

o Details of enclosure of working areas and the location of compounds for the storage of plant and materials; Site security during construction; Site management and access; Vehicle and machinery specifications; Location, numbers and frequency of vehicles/deliveries and measures to ensure construction does not have an effect on neighbouring highways as part of a Construction Logistics Plan (CLP);

o Control measures for noise and vibration (information submitted should directly cross-reference with the BPM & mitigation measures as detailed in the BS 5228-1:2009+A1:2014 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise, BS 5228-2:2009+A1:2014)
o Mitigation measures for dust control (in accordance with the Mayoral SPG for The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition)
o Lighting (Guidance Notes for The Reduction of Light Pollution 2011 by the Institution of Lighting Professionals)
o Construction worker parking
o Procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents

The Demolition and Construction Management Plan shall be implemented on commencement of any works on site and the site shall be managed in accordance with the approved plan for the duration of demolition and construction.

Reason: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of the works, in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) (f) (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012, policy 6.3 of the London Plan (2016) and policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013) and policies D9, D12 , T7 and SI1 of the Draft New London Plan(2019)-intend to publish. | No microwave masts, antennae or satellite dishes or any other plant or equipment shall be installed on the building within the development unless otherwise approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority under this condition prior to installation.

Reason: To safeguard the character and appearance of the buildings and the area as a whole, in accordance with policy 1.1(h) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), Local Variation policies 3.5 and 7.4 and policies 7B of the Development Management Development Plan Document (2013); and policy D4 of the  Draft New London Plan (2019).

| Prior to development commencing on site, tree-protection for identified trees and hedges shall be undertaken in accordance with BS 5837:2012 as recommended in the approved Arboricultural Report and Impact Assessment by Crown Tree Consultancy dated 16 April 2019 in Condition 2.

Reason: To minimise the impacts of demolition and construction on the existing tree and to ensure its preservation for the approved biodiverse landscaping scheme in accordance with policy 5.4 of Ealing's Development Core Strategy(2012) ; policies 5.10 of Ealing's Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 of the London Plan (2016) and policies G1, G5 and G7 of the Draft New London Plan(2019)-intend to publish; the London Environment strategy (2018) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | The residential units hereby approved shall at no time be converted from C3 residential to a C4 small HMO, notwithstanding the provisions of Schedule 2 Part 3 Class L of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order) without express planning permission having first been granted by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and visual appearance of the building, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 and of the London Plan (2016) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | The flank windows facing no. 24 Park Hill shall be obscure glazed and top opening only at 1.8m above internal floor level.

Reason: To protect neighbouring privacy in accordance with policy 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012) and policies7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan DPD 2013. | The cycle parking hereby approved shall be installed prior to the first occupation of the development and shall comprise the provision of at least 14 residential cycle parking spaces in accordance with details approved in Condition 2. Any variation to the approved plans shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the modification being undertaken. The approved details shall be retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure adequate cycle parking is provided within the development in pursuance of the good growth objectives of the Draft New London Plan (2019), and for encouraging sustainable modes of transport in accordance with policy 6.9 of the London Plan (2016), policies 1.1(k) and (g) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), and Ealing's Sustainable Transport for New Development SPG and Draft New London Plan (2019) policy T5.
| The refuse and recycling area shown on the approved drawings shall be provided prior to the first
occupation of the development and retained thereafter and these areas shall not thereafter be obstructed or used for any other purpose.

Reason: To ensure that responsible waste management practices are adhered to in the interests of the visual amenity of the area and in accordance with policy 5.17 of the London Plan (2016); policy 1.1(e) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy (2012); policies 7A, LV7.4 and 7B of Ealing's adopted Development Management DPD (2013); and (interim) SPG 4: Refuse and Recycling Facilities.
